intro: Rathbunia dumortieri, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Rathbunia dumortieri is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations.
